content: © anne macri 2024 #birdiebeanie birdie beanie a top-down baby hat designed for the leftovers from that last pair of socks you knit sized for up to 6 months ish - babies come in all sizes yarn requirements approximately 25-30 g/80-100 yards fingering weight yarn - for reference the finished yellow hat weighed 23 g and the blue hat weighed 29 g gauge 8 sts/in needles - us 3 or as needed to obtain gauge co 8 using the disappearing loop method place marker to note the beginning of the round 1 knit 1 round 2 *kfb knit into the front and back of the stitch an increase * around - 16 stitches 3-6 knit 4 rounds plain 7 *kfb k3* around - 20 stitches 8-11 knit 4 rounds plain 12 *kfb k3* around - 25 stitches 13-16 knit 4 rounds plain 17 *kfb k4* around - 30 stitches 18-21 knit 4 rounds plain 22 *kfb k4* around - 36 stitches 23-26 knit 4 rounds plain 27 *kfb k3* around - 45 stitches 28-31 knit 4 rounds plain 32 *kfb k4* around - 54 stitches 33-36 knit 4 rounds plain 37 *kfb k5* around - 63 stitches 38-41 knit 4 rounds plain 42 *kfb k6* around - 72 stitches 43-45 knit 3 rounds plain 46 *kfb k5* around - 84 stitches 47-49 knit 3 round plain 50 *kfb k6* around - 96 stitches knit 2 5 inches or to 1 inch short of your desired length knit 2 inches 2x2 rib note the ribbed brim is designed to be folded in half if you prefer not to do that you can either knit only 1 inch of ribbing or begin the ribbing 2 inches short of your desired length bind off - i recommend jeny s surprisingly stretchy modification for a slightly taller hat the blue one add one extra knit row between each increase round © anne macri 2024 #birdiebeanie many thanks to my test knitters kiki and katie thanks also to adrian for editing i d love to see your versions of this hat please share what you knit using #birdiebeanie © anne macri 2024 #birdiebeanie
